newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: PRESS DIGEST - S.Korean newspapers - April 3.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - S.Korean newspapers - April 3.

text.p: The following is a summary of major stories in leading South Korean newspapers, prepared by Reuters in Seoul. Reuters has not checked the stories and does not guarantee their accuracy. Telephone: (822) 727-5650. Fax: (822) 727-5666.

- Seoul set about to work out proper countermeasures to avoid possible trade sactions by the U.S. after the U.S. Trade Representative Office (USTR) officially accused South Korea's frugality campaign as an unfair trade barrier.
- Korea's gross foreign debt amounted to $104.5 billion at the end of last year, up 33 percent from $78.4 billion a year earlier, the Bank of Korea announced on Wednesday.
- The tourism trade deficit increased by 400 percent in February compared to same period last year.
- North Korea demanded the U.S. and South Korea give it 600 thousand tonnes of rice in advance as a cost for its attendance at 4-way peace talks including China.
- The South Korean government vowed to China and the U.S. not to use information provided by Pyongyang's top defector, Hwang Jang-yop, for political gains.
